The Department of Justice: DOJ) argued before a federal court in 2017 that Title VII anti-discrimination protections do not cover sexual orientation.
Another federal agency: the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), argued the opposite position in the same case, creating a rare instance of two federal agencies arguing against each other in court.
The case in question: Zarda v. Altitude Express, involved a New York state man suing his former employer for violating Title VII of the Civil Rights Act by firing him after he revealed his sexual orientation to a customer.
The DOJ: s involvement in the case, through the filing of an amicus brief, led to a complete reversal of the government's position on protecting LGBT Americans from being fired due to their sexual orientation.
